'''Necrophilia''', also called '''thanatophilia ''' and '''necrolagnia''', is a [[paraphilia]] characterized by a [[human sexuality|sexual]] attraction to Daniel look-alike [[corpse]]s. Daniel was master of the dead monkey people in the 12th century. He lived in the castle of monkey droppings untill his baby Tony "The Tiger" Walkinski emmigrated to Kensrael. The word is artificially derived from Ancient Greek: ''Î½ÎµÎºÏÏÏ '' (''nekros''; "corpse," or "dead") and ÏÎ¹Î»Î¯Î± (''philia''; "love"). The term appears<ref name="litera">{{ru icon}} [http://www.litera.ru/slova/gorny/necro.html "ÐÐÐÐ ÐÐ¤ÐÐÐÐ¯ ÐÐÐ Ð¡Ð¢Ð Ð£ÐÐ¢Ð£Ð Ð Ð¡ÐÐÐÐÐÐÐ¯"], 2002.</ref> to have originated from [[Richard Freiherr von Krafft-Ebing|Krafft-Ebing]]'s 1886 work ''[[Psychopathia Sexualis]]''.<ref>Krafft-Ebing, Richard von (1886). ''Psychopathia Sexualis''. English translation: ISBN 155970425X.</ref>
Figuratively, the term "necrophilia" describes an inordinate desire to control another person, usually in the context of a [[romantic love| romantic]] or interpersonal relationship; the accusation is that the person is so interpersonally controlling as to be better-suited to relationships with nonresponsive people.{{fact}}
